titles.title: Adjusting the status of an existing position on the Capitol Police for duty with respect to the House of Representatives.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Referred to Subcommittee on Personnel and Police Prior to Introduction (May 6, 93).
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Held; Forwarded to Full Committee by Voice Vote Prior to Introduction (May 6, 93).
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Mr. Manton moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/10/1993--Introduced. Establishes one additional position of lieutenant on the Capitol Police to serve as agency training representative for duty under the House of Representatives. Abolishes the former position of an officer or member serving as agency training representative established by H. Res. 320, 99th Congress.
